data.title: Fiona Williams
data.meta_description: Fiona is a multi-media artist working in Bristol with painting, sculpture and jewellery making This new work is part of our group project responding to the theme of Colour.   During this exhibition...
data.text:
Fiona is a multi-media artist working in Bristol with painting, sculpture and jewellery making

This new work is part of our group project responding to the theme of Colour.

During this exhibition cycle I have let my mind wander through ideas of visibility, opaqueness, perception, transparency, reflection and luminescence. Thinking about what I enjoy looking at and what I am drawn to, as well as how I perceive colours through all my senses. I have been inspired by the artists Odilon Redon, William Blake, Eric Ravilious and Paula Rego alongside the interiors of Sir John Soane’s house, Charleston, Museums and breakfast cafes.

I have explored our theme through its association with emotions, mood, movement, aesthetics and identity. These colours include: night- time fears, the depth of velvet, cups of tea, longing, shimmering light, a sense of home, jewels and metals, convex mirrors, embroidery, memories, fairground rides, the sea, overheard conversations and quiet musings.

Winged Hypnos

Acrylic on canvas 2023

Image adapted from a Roman copy of a Greek bronze head of Hypnos in the British Museum collection since 1868

Donkey, my Friend

Watercolour and pencil drawing torn and reassembled on magazine cover published in 1952

Elytra and Fountain

Acrylic on canvas 2023

Shining Blue Castle

Photograph 2023

Image of found black and white tourist photograph showing a beautiful view in the Cote d’Azur viewed through a glass prism on a magazine cover from 1952.

Bowl of Gold & Figure

Acrylic on canvas 2023

Goldfish image adapted from fireplace design by Duncan Grant 1925, Charleston.
